snippet: Eatsa, the first in a chain of quinoa restaurants with national ambitions, is almost fully automated.
abstract: The Upshot; San Francisco restaurant Eats is almost fully automated and is first in chain planned by company; customers order and receive their food without ever dealing with any staff; supporters say concept is aimed at making restaurants more efficient and cheaper, while critics view it as yet more evidence that automation is destroying workers' jobs.
lead_paragraph: Eatsa, the first in a chain of quinoa restaurants with national ambitions, is almost fully automated.

headline.main: Restaurant of the Future? Service With an Impersonal Touch
